content:
Does that happen with all links, just that one, or with other FB links as well?

>Would there be anything in the TB Error Console?

Are you asking before you open it, or did you mean 'should there be anything' because you looked and nothing relevant was there?
creator: siffemoz

content: IIRC, I have seen this only for Facebook links. My comment about the Error Console is a basic question about error debugging. Twice I have looked in the Error Console and found nothing, but TB might have downloaded new mail between the time of the error message and my looking at the Error Console, so all the info about the newly downloaded messages are at the bottom of the Console, and any error message about my problem would be earlier in the Console.
creator: bsfinkel

content: Open the console > click the trash can upper left corner to clear it out. Then try a FB link.
creator: siffemoz

content:
1. It's under Options on the compose screen menu bar. If you don't see the menu bar on top, press the ALT key.

2. Does pressing F5 work to get new messages?
creator: siffemoz

content: I suggest removing the OAUTH authentication, check that cookies are enabled, and then set the OAUTH again. There is a disconnect somewhere in authorizing the account, but restarting the process usually corrects it.

content: Are there any error messages?
creator: davidsk

content:
Difficile dirlo. La disinstallazione potrebbe aver eliminato anche il profilo; dipende da quali opzioni hai scelto. E dipende anche dal formato che stai usando, DEB o Snap, che funzionano in maniera differente.

Tuttavia ti conviene chiedere su un forum dedicato ad Ubuntu, personalmente non uso Linux e non saprei dirti di preciso dove vengono salvati i profili. È comunque una informazione che puoi recuperare da Thunderbird: Tasto menu > Aiuto > Informazione per la risoluzione dei problemi
creator: @next

content: la reinstallazione non potrebbe semplicemente aver caricato un vecchio profilo? come faccio a saper qual è l'ultimo profilo utilizzato?
creator: ctomas61

content:
Come ho scritto sopra: - dipende da quale versione hai usato in passato e da quale hai installato ora - la versione Deb e quella Snap usano cartelle differenti. E una non può vedere le cartelle dell'altra.

Senza sapere almeno queste informazioni è impossibile dire di più. Ripeto anche che sarebbe meglio se chiedessi in forum dedicati ad Ubuntu. Io non conosco questo sistema operativo ed il livello di attività del forum è molto basso in questo periodo.
creator: @next

content:
No you did not purchase Thunderbird. It is Free as in free beer.

Did you perhaps make a donation to the project here https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/donate/

If you did, you will need to contact the donor care folks on the link provided on that page to discuss the options available. https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/donate/help/.

content: It is not Thunderbird rejecting it, but your email provider. This may be due to incorrect setup. If you post screenshot of your incoming and outgoing server setup panes, some suggestions may come forth. Also, some email providers require alternate passwords. For any error messages, please translate to English. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: You can check settings>privacy&security and see if the password is still there, but you will probably need to contact email provider to reset the password.
creator: davidsk
